A reinstallation helped, thanks! 
Just a further question: Is there any routine/procedure in CANTERA  
to use a thermodynamics data file in the NASA format (where comments 
and  molecular weights are in the first line instead of the three 
temperatures)? My test with the  ck2cti.exe program resulted in 
several error messages.
Regards,
Burak

 

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> The file _cantera.pyd should be all you need. It looks to me like 
you  
> have installed Cantera somewhere other than in the site_packages  
> directory that is the default. If so, did you set environment 
variable  
> PYTHONPATH to point to this directory? You might try reinstalling 
in  
> site_packages to see if that helps... otherwise I'm not sure. 
Anyone  
> else have this problem?
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On Tuesday, September 30, 2003, at 04:39 AM, galliumnitrid wrote:
> 
> > Dear Dr. Goodwin,
> > I just installed cantera(1.5) and python on my windows computer.
> > As I wanted to test it, I received the following error message:
> > Traceback (most recent call last):
> >
> > 
File "D:\Programme\ThermoPrgsKlein\CANTERA\demos\Python\reactor1.py",
> > line 6, in -toplevel-
> >     from Cantera import *
> >   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\__init__.py", line 7, 
in -
> > toplevel-
> >     from gases import *
> >   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\gases.py", line 4, 
in -
> > toplevel-
> >     from solution import Solution
> >   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\solution.py", line 8, 
in -
> > toplevel-
> >     from ThermoPhase import ThermoPhase
> >   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\ThermoPhase.py", line 
4,
> > in -toplevel-
> >     from Cantera.Phase import Phase
> >   File "D:\PROGRA~1\KINETICS\Python\Cantera\Phase.py", line 7, 
in -
> > toplevel-
> >     import _cantera
> > ImportError: No module named _cantera
> >
> > I found a file named _cantera.pyd but none called _cantera.py
> >
> > Could you help me?
> > Thank you!
> > B. Atakan
